page.title: 01LANIVET AND AREA
page.content: Our twelve squares are in Cornwall and we are S.W. of Bodmin. Lanivet is considered the centre of Cornwall. Our grid reference is 02000063. There is one village called Lanivet and five hamlets called Retire, Withielgoose, Tremore, Lamorick and Withielgoose Mills. The land is high and used mainly for farmland.The highest point is 549m above sea level. There are two streams running to the{River Camel.}There are remains of tin mines and granite quarries. There are small areas of woodland. Some of the businesses in our block are bed and breakfast,I.M.B. Welding, farming, fruit and vegetable sales and motor sales.
